thag12.1:1.1: One should train just in ethical conduct,
thag12.1:1.2: for in this world, when ethical conduct is
thag12.1:2.1: Wishing for three kinds of happiness—
thag12.1:2.3: and to delight in heaven after passing away—
thag12.1:2.4: the wise would take care of their ethics.
thag12.1:3.3: But one lacking ethics, of bad conduct,
thag12.1:4.1: A person whose ethics are bad has
thag12.1:4.3: A person whose conduct is ethical always has
thag12.1:4.4: a good reputation, fame, and praise.
thag12.1:5.1: Ethical conduct is the starting point and foundation;
thag12.1:5.4: that’s why you should purify your ethics.
thag12.1:6.1: Ethics provide a boundary and a restraint,
thag12.1:6.3: the ford where all the Buddhas cross over:
thag12.1:6.4: that’s why you should purify your ethics.
thag12.1:7.4: ethics are a marvelous coat of armor.
thag12.1:8.4: that float from place to place.
thag12.1:9.2: ethics are the unsurpassed supply for a journey;
thag12.1:9.4: that take you from place to place.
thag12.1:10.2: after departing they grieve in a lower realm;
thag12.1:10.4: because they are unsteady in ethics.
thag12.1:11.2: after departing they’re happy in heaven;
thag12.1:11.3: a wise one is happy everywhere,
thag12.1:11.4: because they are steady in ethics.
thag12.1:12.1: Ethical conduct is best in this life,
thag12.1:12.2: but one with wisdom is supreme.
thag12.1:12.3: Someone with both virtue and wisdom
thag12.1:12.4: is victorious among men and gods.
